name: Scyther

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of it.

strengths: Free retreat cost - can pivot freely
70 HP is excellent for a Basic
Swords Dance + Slash combo deals 60 damage
Colorless attack cost works with any energy
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - Powers Slash immediately

competitiveHistory: Scyther was a cornerstone of the Haymaker archetype and one of the most played cards in early Pokemon TCG. Free retreat, Fighting resistance (protecting against Hitmonchan), and colorless attack costs made it incredibly versatile. It could pivot around damage while threatening with Slash.

rulings.ruling: Swords Dance's effect only lasts until your next turn. After that turn, Slash returns to 30 base damage.
If Scyther is Benched or otherwise doesn't use Slash on the turn after Swords Dance, the boost is lost.
The Swords Dance boost affects base damage before Weakness/Resistance and other modifiers.
Scyther's free retreat makes it excellent for tactical switching.
